p: In a 2009–2011 study in a Northern Indian rural community [ 21], the best performance was for cough (aDOR 3.1; 95% CI 1.5–6.7), followed by measured fever >38 °C (aDOR 2.5; 95% CI 1.3–4.9). In contrast, the reported fever was not associated with laboratory-confirmed influenza cases (aDOR 1.3; 95% CI 0.5–3.6).
